description: From Latin pervāsus, from pervādō (“spread through, pervade”), from per (“through”) + vādō (“go, walk”).

adjectives.description: pervasive (comparative more pervasive, superlative most pervasive)

entries.meaning: Manifested throughout; pervading, permeating, penetrating or affecting everything.
examples: The medication had a pervasive effect on the patient's health.
